issues.title: Hint balloon covers the cursor line and makes it impossible to see what is being typed
issues.body:
I reported this to the Andoid Studio team. They said this is a problem with the flutter-intellij plugin.
When creating a new widget, when it goes to a new line during the passage of parameters, the balloon covers the cursor line making it impossible to see what is being typed.
I made an image of the screen capture, and a screencast video, for a better understanding of what happens.

Version: Flutter 1.17.2
IDE: Android Studio 4.0
SO: Linux
Image: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Y2TscaJoZZBQmM2sDQd63EJE3dMO1Uph/view?usp=sharing
Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XBcHVanEO5A

issues.title: android studio totally frozen with Flutter plugin v45
issues.body:
installing Flutter plugin v45 in android studio 192.7142 makes it totally frozen for about 20 seconds when switching editor dart tabs,
switching back Flutter plugin to v44 solved the problem.

issues.title: flutter project not getting build
issues.body:
Thanks for the feedback! If your issue is related to the Flutter framework itself,
please open an issue at
[github.com/flutter/flutter](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/new).

## Steps to Reproduce
## What happened

(please describe what you were doing when this exception occurred)

## Version information

Android Studio `3.5.3` • Flutter plugin `io.flutter 42.1.1` • Dart plugin `191.8593`

No Flutter sdk configured.

## Exception

null

```

issues.title: Console log begins with output from the previous run
issues.body:
## Steps to Reproduce

* Start you Flutter application in Intellij (Run/Debug)
* Look at Console

The output is polluted by the output from the previous run.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2590174/71988896-fcd72a80-3230-11ea-862f-bdf4532fc0b6.png)

(in this case, the stack trace comes from the exception that occured in the previous run)

issues.title: Analyzer is running very slowly in IntelliJ
issues.body:
## Steps to Reproduce

As I edit the Flutter repo code, the responsiveness of the analyzer integration in IntelliJ seems to get worse and worse.  It helps some to "clear caches and restart", but only for a little while. My memory limit for IntelliJ are boosted (`-Xms512m -Xmx6144m -XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize=512m`), so I don't think that's the issue, or if it is, it's using an awful lot of memory... 

It's slow enough that as I edit code, I can watch the syntax highlighting update about once every two to 15 seconds, which is far to slow to be useful.  The suggestions dialog takes 3-4 seconds to show up, and another second or two to populate, sometimes showing the little in-menu spinner for ten seconds before showing any information, and sometimes it just gives up after 20 seconds or so with "No Suggestions" when I know for sure that there are valid suggestions to make.

Is there any information I can collect for you that will help you fix this? It's really hampering my productivity.

I captured a CPU profiling snapshot while this was happening, if that helps.

## Version info
```
✓] Flutter (Channel add_macos_platform, v1.10.15-pre.240, on Linux, locale en_US.UTF-8)
    • Flutter version 1.10.15-pre.240 at [redacted]

[✓] IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition (version 2019.2)

```

issues.title: developer.log output to console in Android Studio does not appear first time
issues.body:
Using Android Studio v3.5 and Dart Plugin v191.8423 and Flutter v1.9.1.

When running a Flutter app in debug mode, on first run when calling developer.log, no output appears in the console:

First debug run console output:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5154664/65959472-6e1a7b00-e495-11e9-9d3b-921d66f60c38.png)

Hot Restart the app console output:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5154664/65959496-812d4b00-e495-11e9-8980-f02b0d9e1ca5.png)

Expect developer.log output to console for all runs, not just after Hot Restart. Optionally the name property output to be color coded based on level property when calling developer.log, might be nice. Property level is 0 to 2000 so perhaps if 0 - 500 appears red in console, 501 - 1000 appears blue in console etc.

issues.title: Flutter Plugin v39.0.5: code analysis stops working, 100% CPU
issues.body:
## Steps to Reproduce

Editing code, not sure what triggers this to happen. It happened twice in 15 minutes, after updating the plugin to 39.0.5. Everything works fine until:

- IntelliJ editor highlights an error (for example, this time it's a final field that I haven't initialized in the constructor, since I'm in the middle of adding this final field to my class)
- IntelliJ code error does not get un-highlighted after fixing the code. Code analysis seems to have stopped and remains in this state.
- `dart` process shows high CPU usage in the MacOS Activity Monitor.
- laptop heats up, can't get much done

Will try to reboot and see if that does anything. If not, will have to figure out how to downgrade to the previous version and see if that works.


## Version info

issues.title: Flutter menu is desabled
issues.body:
There is 2 ways to open Android module in the Flutter project according [docs](https://flutter.dev/docs/development/tools/android-studio#editing-android-code-in-android-studio-with-full-ide-support):
- `Flutter > Open Android module in Android Studio.`
- Link labeled `Open for Editing in Android Studio` when open any files inside `android` folder.

The second way still works but the `Flutter` menu item currently is disabled for me when I click on `android` folder in the Project View.

## Version info

```

issues.title: The IntelliJ is often very laggy when editing package:flutter/src/foundation/diagnostics.dart
issues.body:
The IntelliJ is often very laggy when editing `package:flutter/src/foundation/diagnostics.dart`
There can be a 1 or 2 second pause before typing a character and changes showing up in the IDE. Even if the analyzer is a bit slow due to the number of files invalidated by this change, we should not be blocking text input.

Suggested fix: verify we are not performing unexpected blocking work on the UI thread.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Swap order nodeChanged and nodeStructureChanged were called.

This likely solves https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/3756
by avoiding an edge case where the node structure change needs to occur first
or else invalid cached data is present in the model.

Swap order nodeChanged and nodeStructureChanged were called. (#3827)

This likely solves https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/3756
by avoiding an edge case where the node structure change needs to occur first
or else invalid cached data is present in the model.

issues.title: Show closing labels in Android Studio not saving and impossible to keymap
issues.body: ## Steps to Reproduce When opening a new flutter project, I need to (re)check the "Show closing labels in Dart source code" box. The issue is known and some advised that we should keymap it. I searched for a long time in the "keymap browser". I just could'nt find it. So i ask for you help. Thanks ## Version info Android Studio (version 3.4)

issues.title: Show closing labels in Dart source code preferences not saving between Android Studio launches.
issues.body: **## Steps to Reproduce** **Issue `#1` Closing Labels** I truly enjoy using this software. However, I have an annoyance with one thing. I have noticed after setting the preferences to allow the Android Studio to **_Show closing labels in Dart source code_,** this setting does not stay set. The next time I open Android Studio, the allowance has to be rechecked. I found another user suffering from the same annoyance in regards to the "Show closing Labels setting" - @MargrietPB who may also be willing to provide you with some feedback on this issue if needed. **Issue `#2` Copyright Settings** I also noticed a similar issue with the copyright settings. I put the copyright profile into the preferences and the next time the software is opened, only the scope setting from the profile remain. I am not completely sure this next statement has anything to do with the issue but while looking for an answer to correct this problem, I came across an uninstall guide for Android Studio that mentions these preferences files which are supposed to be located in the Library. ~/Library/Preferences/AndroidStudio ~/Library/Preferences/com.google.android ~/Library/Preferences/com.android However, I did not find any of these files from the list on my Mac. I am curious if this is happening because of something I have failed to do or if there may be some other solution to this issue. **## Version info** Android Studio 3.4.1 [✓] Flutter (Channel stable, v1.5.4-hotfix.2, on Mac OS X 10.14.5 18F132, locale en-US) • Flutter version 1.5.4-hotfix.2 at /Users/jimbray/Developer/flutter • Framework revision 7a4c33425d (3 weeks ago), 2019-04-29 11:05:24 -0700 • Engine revision 52c7a1e849 • Dart version 2.3.0 (build 2.3.0-dev.0.5 a1668566e5) [✓] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 28.0.3) • Android SDK at /Users/jimbray/Library/Android/sdk • Android NDK location not configured (optional; useful for native profiling support) • Platform android-28, build-tools 28.0.3 • Java binary at: /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents/jre/jdk/Contents/Home/bin/java • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_152-release-1343-b01) • All Android licenses accepted. [✓] iOS toolchain - develop for iOS devices (Xcode 10.2.1) • Xcode at /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer • Xcode 10.2.1, Build version 10E1001 • ios-deploy 1.9.4 • CocoaPods version 1.6.1 [✓] Android Studio (version 3.4) • Android Studio at /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents • Flutter plugin version 35.3.1 • Dart plugin version 183.6270 • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_152-release-1343-b01) [✓] Connected device (1 available) • iPhone Xs • ADFCB658-5F95-4639-BC60-2B1FFEA128F0 • ios • com.apple.CoreSimulator.SimRuntime.iOS-12-2 (simulator) • No issues found! Process finished with exit code 0 Thank you Jim Bray

issues.title: Intellij Dart/Flutter plugin changed `import` to `mport` on save file.
issues.body:
## Steps to Reproduce

This issue only happened on one file in my project.
The last `import` will be wrong after I press `CMD + S` to save the file.

The error is the `import` is changed to `mport`.

There is a workaround that I have to quit intellij idea, then open it again (without touch to that file).

issues.title: Unable to wrap widgets on function expressions "=>" - only works for function bodies.
issues.body: Annoying use case I encounter a lot is this: I want to wrap my `KiwiScaffold` into whatever widget, I can't because the IDE doesn't let me have the quick actions, I have to transform it into "block body" to be able to have those: I should be able to do that into an expression body too.

issues.title: File descriptor leak in PluginConfig.load()
issues.body:
Android Studio 3.5 Canary 6 with Flutter plugin v33.3.2 runs out of file descriptors on Mac, subsequently failing every I/O call with "Too many open files".

A quick lsof inspection of the process showed ~10K entries for `config/intellij-plugins/flutter.json`.

One idea: does PluginConfig.load() close the InputStreamReader, or should that be a try-with-resources in 
https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/blob/master/src/io/flutter/bazel/PluginConfig.java#L75 
(I don't know if GSON.fromJson() is supposed to close it.)

issues.title: Illegal Null argument on start-up
issues.body:
Please file this bug report at https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/new.

---

## What happened

Error appeared in console after creating first Flutter project. 
There was an error message when creating the plugin that no SDK found. There was a button "Install SDK" (or similar) which I pressed a couple of time with nothing happening.

## Version information

Android Studio `3.2.1` • Flutter plugin `io.flutter 31.2.1` • Dart plugin `181.5656`

Error getting Flutter sdk information.

## Exception

Argument for @NotNull parameter 'e' of io/flutter/actions/InstallSdkAction.actionPerformed must not be null

```
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Argument for @NotNull parameter 'e' of io/flutter/actions/InstallSdkAction.actionPerformed must not be null
	at io.flutter.actions.InstallSdkAction.$$$reportNull$$$0(InstallSdkAction.java)

issues.title: Bug: Widgets code actions are available on fields too!
issues.body:
@rrousselGit commented on [Wed Oct 17 2018](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/23213)

Consider the following code:

```dart
class Foo extends StatelessWidget {
  final Widget child;

}
```

When focusing `child`  and attempting to use refactoring tools, the IDE will suggest the usual widget refactoring stuff:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20165741/47100047-e06b5e80-d236-11e8-9876-eb293600352d.png)


This obviously doesn't make sense. And using them leads to an invalid code.

---

@zoechi commented on [Wed Oct 17 2018](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/23213#issuecomment-430726860)

Please add the output of `flutter doctor -v`.

---

@zoechi commented on [Wed Oct 17 2018](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/23213#issuecomment-430755434)

a bit outdated, but I wouldn't expect changes in this area since then.

---

issues.title: Memory Profiler load failure in IDEA
issues.body:
## What happened

  1. Create a new Flutter Project using IntelliJ Ultimate
  2. Open Android Emulator (haven't tried iOS)
  2. Run/Debug Flutter project
  3. Builds fine, then deployed to app
  4. When app is launched, see Exception pop up in IntelliJ.
  5. Perhaps related? Unable to see the Widget tree in the Flutter Inspector.

## Solutions Tried / Other bits

  1. I tried disabling the `--track-widget-creation` option. No effect.
  2. Everything seems to be working, except the Widget tree (setting break points, performance view, etc).
  3. No errors received in Android Studio, Widget tree shown.
  4. Tried Beta / Dev / Master branches, none worked.

issues.title: Select widget button in flutter inspector is grayed out
issues.body:
Thanks for the feedback! If your issue is related to the Flutter framework itself,
please open an issue at
[github.com/flutter/flutter](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/new).

## Steps to Reproduce

_Please tell us what you were doing and what went wrong_
I ran an app and the flutter inspector shows the widget tree but pressing on the select widget mode does nothing and it looks like the button is grayed out.

## Version info

Please paste the output of running `flutter doctor -v` here (available from the command
line or from `Tools > Flutter > Flutter Doctor`). It will provide the version of the

issues.title: Import Flutter module doesn't work on Windows
issues.body:
1. Follow the steps on https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Add-Flutter-to-existing-apps to import a Flutter module to an Android app using Windows.

=> Gradle complains that a character is incorectly escaped:

```
settings file 'C:\Users\mit\tmp\plugtest\flutter_plugin\example\MyApplication\settings.gradle': 5: unexpected char: '\' @ line 5, column 6.
     '..\..\..\mod42\.android\include_flutter.groovy'
        ^
```

Changing the string to this seems to fix it:
```
evaluate(new File(
  settingsDir.parentFile,
  '..\\..\\..\\mod42\\.android\\include_flutter.groovy'
))
```

issues.title: [ColorIcons] Color icons not showing for consts with func scope
issues.body:
In [themes.dart from flutter gallery](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/master/examples/flutter_gallery/lib/gallery/themes.dart)

See image. The consts `primaryColor` and `secondaryColor` are not showing a color icon on the left.

Nice to have: since they are consts, it would be great it it showed the same icon where they are consumed like line 34-35.



![screen shot 2018-10-11 at 12 13 41 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1271525/46818641-bfdf6800-cd4f-11e8-9e2d-2643555f311b.png)

issues.title: [Inspector] Widget mode tool tips don't respect SafeArea
issues.body:
Using inspector widget mode on iPhone X+, the notch occludes the tool tip for selected widgets in that general area.
![screen shot 2018-10-09 at 11 02 13 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1271525/46678627-0c417100-cbb3-11e8-8900-57e06b885855.png)

They should respect the MediaQuery padding (SafeArea).

issues.title: Evaluating an expression @ a breakpoint causes analysis to fall down.

issues.title: No exception information for analysis server errors
issues.body:
Thanks for the feedback! If your issue is related to the Flutter framework itself,
please open an issue at
[github.com/flutter/flutter](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/new).

## Steps to Reproduce
Adding new code to make an HTTP call.
Had just added `import 'package:http/http.dart' as http;` and then started typing the line below.

```
Future<String> _backgroundJob(int dummy) async {
  print("starting backgroundJob");
  var client = http.C    // HERE.  Was typing this line when the Dart Analyzer error occurred
  while (true) {
    Future<http.Resposne>
    print("in backgroundJob");
    sleep(Duration(seconds: 10));
  }
  return "done";
}

```

issues.title: Flutter Inspector's "Select Widget" mode not working with CupertinoApp
Possible Flutter inspector memory leak
issues.body:
Saw this in the debugger console while running a debuggable Android Studio. I had two projects open in separate AS windows. The active window was for an Android project that had a debugger running. The other window was a Flutter project for a module used in the Android project. Oddly enough, the Android project had a right-side tab labeled `Flutter Outline` and another `Flutter Inspector`. I wouldn't expect to see either in a project window for a non-Flutter project.

issues.title: 'convert to async function body' doesn't grok abstract accessor functions properly.
Plugin Android module template needs work
issues.body:
Create a plugin project that uses Kotlin. The Android module that is generated includes content roots that point to directories named "java". The Kotlin code doesn't get indexed. The template files used by the Flutter tool need to be updated to work for both Java and Kotlin.

The app template also needs work, but it isn't quite as bad. It does need to have the "kotlin" directory added as a content root, though.

issues.title: make sure we save pubspec.yaml contents to disk when running "packages get" / upgrade
issues.body:
*@fmatosqg commented on Apr 20, 2018, 5:15 AM UTC:*

## Steps to Reproduce

*   Edit pubspec.yaml
*   Immediately click `get packages`
*   Notice that it won't read the latest changes

If you `cmd+s` before clicking the expected result happens.

AS 3.1.1 with flutter plugin 23.2.2 and flutter beta 2.

*This issue was moved by [devoncarew](https://github.com/devoncarew) from [flutter/flutter#16786](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/16786).*

issues.title: Breakpoints do not persist after hot reload
issues.body:
Version: Android Studio 3.1.3
Plugin: 26.0.1

1. Create a project.
2. Set a breakpoint.
3. Run to breakpoint.
5. Modify the code.
5. Hot reload.
6. Resume.
7. Run again.

Breakpoint is ignored.

I'm using the default project with breakpoint and code mods as per test script.

issues.title: "Wrap with new widget" not playing nice with named constructor
issues.body:
## Steps to Reproduce

I have an app with just this source code in main.dart:

```
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() => runApp(
      new MaterialApp(
        home: Scaffold(
          body: ListView.builder(
            itemCount: 3,
            itemBuilder: (context, index) => Text('Some text'),
          ),
        ),
      ),
    );
```

If I place the cursor on the `ListView` part of `ListView.builder` and choose "Wrap with new widget" from the alt-enter pop-up menu, all of `ListView.builder` is replaced with the `new widget`:

```
body: new widget(
```

If I place the cursor on the `builder` part of `ListView.builder` and do that, however, I get this:

```
body: ListView.new widget(child: builder)(
```

## Version info

```
$ flutter doctor
Doctor summary (to see all details, run flutter doctor -v):

issues.title: NPE on rebuild after restoring Android Studio

issues.title: bug in AS 3.1 affects the inspector
issues.body: There's a bug in AS 3.1 which is impacting the inspector. The tab the we use to display "no running devices" in the inspector doesn't get removed when an app runs. It makes it look like the inspector just never recognized that an app launched: We should find a workaround to the issue, or remove the "no running devices" initial tab, at least for Android Studio 3.1. @jacob314 @stevemessick

issues.title: Error while drilling down the tree in the "Flutter Inspector"
issues.body:
## What happened

I was drilling down the widget tree in the "Flutter Inspector". When I reached `SliverList` and iterated over its `AutomaticKeepAlive` children, this happened. It seems the inspector attempts to automatically expand the nodes, but does this asynchronously. By the time it expands I already moved on to another item. issues.title: printing a List of Maps on iOS simulator displays an exception in IntelliJ
issues.body:
## What happened

relevant code (in main):

```
  List<Map> expectedList = [
    {"name": "updated name", "id": 1, "value": 9876, "num": 456.789},
    {"name": "another name", "id": 2, "value": 12345678, "num": 3.1416}
  ];
  print(expectedList);

```

This happens on build (full restart) for iOS in the iPhone X simulator.  Does not happen when building (full restart) on an android phone plugged in.  

Simpler examples such as:

```
  List<String> l = ["hello", "bye"];
  print(l);
```
and
```
  Map m = {"name": "updated name", "id": 1, "value": 9876, "num": 456.789};
  print(m);
```
work as expected


## Version information

Android Studio `3.0.1` • Flutter plugin `io.flutter 22.2.1` • Dart plugin `171.4424`

Flutter 0.1.4 • channel beta • https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git
Framework • revision f914e701c5 (12 days ago) • 2018-02-19 21:12:17 +0000
Engine • revision 13cf22c284
Tools • Dart 2.0.0-dev.27.0-flutter-0d5cf900b0

• No issues found!
Process finished with exit code 0

issues.title: The run button should be disabled when debugging an app (and vice versa)
issues.body:
If the developer runs the app not attached to the debugger, then decides to restart the app with debugging enabled by either going to "Run > Debug" or hitting the "Debug" button... nothing happens.

Similarly, if they've already started the app with debugging enabled, and they hit the "Debug" button again, nothing happens.

In the first case, the app should probably be restarted with debugging enabled.  Alternatively, the button and menu option should be disabled.

In the second case, for parity with what happens when you click "Run" when the app is already running, we should probably perform a full restart (with debugging enabled).

issues.title: Running unit tests from the left gutter breaks debugging unit test
issues.body:
## Steps to Reproduce

Running the tests from the left gutter breaks. The only way to run them again is restarting IntelliJ. 
1. Set a break point in the test case
2. Run a unit test from the left gutter run or debug button. (don't stop debugging process)
3. Then click on debug button in the top menu, right of the device selection. (try to start process again)

What I think is happening, when trying to start the debugging process again before it was completed while paused on a break point creates an inconsistent state. I've noticed an exception thrown in IDE log as well but I can't replicate it again. What I'm finding my problem is, I forget to resume past the break point so the unit test finishes. And then I try to start it over while it's paused, the second process doesn't restart. Once I terminate the process, I can no longer launch  another debugging instance from the left gutter button.

issues.title: Spawning an Isolate freezes the Widget and Render Tree Inspector
issues.body:
Spawning an Isolate freezes the Widget and Render Tree Inspector, until all the spawned isolates are killed.
This is sub-optimal because inside our apps we spawn a couple of isolates at the very beginning of the app lifecycle and we almost never kill them. 

## Steps to Reproduce

1) Run these commands:
```
cd flutter/examples/layers/
flutter run -t services/isolate.dart
```
2) Click the Start button
Notice that the Flutter Ispector is frozen inside its Widgets and Render Tree views until the Isolate is killed.

## Version info

Tested on a Nexus 5 with a very recent framework build

issues.title: Inspector doesn't work if it is closed when app starts up
issues.body:
## Steps to Reproduce

Open an application with the inspector closed. Open the inspector after the app starts up.

Inspector does not work.

Workaround: make sure the inspector is open before the app arts.

issues.title: `Open iOS Simulator` crashes after upgrading to Xcode 9.1
issues.body:
## What happened

I was trying to "Open iOS Simulator" from the Flutter toolbar just after upgrading to Xcode 9.1. It crashed with the cryptic error message below.

Turns out I had to first open the Xcode app and let it do its thing ("install required components" or
something like that). So this is an issue with not reporting a meaningful error.

## Version information

issues.title: Color preview in IDE doesn't work properly when using the shade properties
issues.body:
## Steps to Reproduce

When I specify the color using a key, I can get an accurate preview of the color on the sidebar. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/348942/35074288-03c82e38-fba2-11e7-90af-2571bb5c35dc.png)

When I specify the color using the primary color's shade properties, I got the primary color instead of the specified shade displayed on the sidebar.

setState() called after dispose(): _WidgetInspectorState#16c8a(lifecycle state: defunct, not mounted)
This error happens if you call setState() on a State object for a widget that no longer appears in the widget tree (e.g., whose parent widget no longer includes the widget in its build). This error can occur when code calls setState() from a timer or an animation callback. The preferred solution is to cancel the timer or stop listening to the animation in the dispose() callback. Another solution is to check the "mounted" property of this object before calling setState() to ensure the object is still in the tree.

issues.title: Trouble running widget tests w/ 2 IDEA instances running
issues.body:
I used to be able to right-click on the code of a flutter test and select "Run \<test name\>" from the context menu. Recently, this started producing the following error in the UI instead of running the test:

```
2:23 PM	Error running 'Semantics tree is populated mid-scroll': @NotNull method io/flutter/run/test/TestLaunchState.startProcess must not return null
```

issues.title: Can't run plugin example flutter tests (wrong CWD).
issues.body:
The rub is we run `flutter test` from the root of the project (e.g., `project/`) which contains a pubspec without the flutter_test dev dependency.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67586/33687293-96d0a80e-da8c-11e7-833c-29e37374fd86.png)

Proposed solution: have the run configuration do the right thing and run flutter test from within `project/example`.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Improve pub root detection for flutter tests (#1575). (#1585)

* Improve pub root detection for flutter tests (#1575).

Fixes: #1575

* Doc fix.

issues.title: Plugin example tests not recognized as Flutter tests.
issues.body:
Plugin example tests live in `example/test` and are not recognized by our test discovery logic.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67586/33683722-c198dc7a-da80-11e7-892c-44d39e01c19f.png)

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fix test discovery for plugin example tests (#1572). (#1573)

Fixes: #1572

@jacob314

issues.title: encountered a FlutterError('Id does not exist') when selecting a node in the inspector
issues.body:
I saw a `FlutterError('Id does not exist')` exception when using the inspector. To repro:

- run an app
- reload once; this populates the widget tree
- select a widget node from the tree (I selected the first child of the `[root]` node)

@jacob314

issues.title: Can't run `test` or `testWidget` tests individually inside a `group`
issues.body: Hey hey, thanks for all the hard work on the plugin :) Getting better and better! When a `test` or `testWidgets` test is embedded inside a `group` in a Flutter project, the tests cannot be run individually. When I try to run the tests individually, it runs the entire `group`. It would be amazing if the `test` / `testWidgets` could be run / debugged individually. Overall, there is some funny stuff happening: In a "Flutter Project" in Webstorm: 1. `testWidget` tests always shows that it will be run as a group. When "Run button" is clicked, entire group of tests execute. 2. `test` tests show they will be run individually, but when "Run Button" is clicked, the entire group is in fact executed. 3. Using the "Run Context Configuration" keyboard shortcut within a `test` or `testWidget` inside a `group` causes the whole `group` to be run. 4. Importing `package:test/test.dart` instead of `package:flutter_test/flutter_test.dart` had no impact. In a "Normal Dart" project in Webstorm: 1. `test` tests do not show "Run buttons", but can in fact be run / debugged individually using the "Run Context Configuration" keyboard shortcut. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Create a new flutter project 2. Create a new file under `test/group_test.dart` 3. Paste the code below into the file 4. Attempt to run / debug each test individually using Run Buttons and Keyboard Shortcuts 5. Do the same thing, but starting from a normal Dart project instead of a Flutter project (removing the `testWidget` test and changing the import to the normal `test` package) to see the difference. ```dart import 'package:flutter_test/flutter_test.dart'; void main() { group('The Entire Group', () { test('seems to indicate individual run works fine, but it still runs the whole group.', () { expect(true, true); }); testWidgets('always runs in a group', (tester) { expect(true, true); }); }); } ``` ## Screenshots ## Version info [✓] Flutter (on Mac OS X 10.13 17A405, locale en-US, channel master) • Flutter at /Users/phillywiggins/lab/flutter • Framework revision cbfed1960f (23 hours ago), 2017-10-25 07:18:09 -0700 • Engine revision ec19da1c80 • Tools Dart version 1.25.0-dev.11.0 [✓] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK 26.0.2) • Android SDK at /Users/phillywiggins/Library/Android/sdk • Platform android-26, build-tools 26.0.2 • ANDROID_HOME = /Users/phillywiggins/Library/Android/sdk • Java binary at: /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents/jre/jdk/Contents/Home/bin/java • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_152-release-915-b08) [-] iOS toolchain - develop for iOS devices (Xcode 9.0.1) • Xcode at /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer • Xcode 9.0.1, Build version 9A1004 • ios-deploy 1.9.2 ✗ CocoaPods not installed. CocoaPods is used to retrieve the iOS platform side's plugin code that responds to your plugin usage on the Dart side. Without resolving iOS dependencies with CocoaPods, plugins will not work on iOS. For more info, see https://flutter.io/platform-plugins To install: brew install cocoapods pod setup [✓] Android Studio • Android Studio at /Applications/Android Studio 3.0 Preview.app/Contents • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_152-release-915-b01) [✓] Android Studio (version 3.0) • Android Studio at /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_152-release-915-b08) [✓] IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition (version 2017.2.3) • Flutter plugin version 17.0 • Dart plugin version 172.3968.27 [✓] Connected devices • None

issues.title: Bad module name
issues.body:
Try typing this into the name field of the new package or module wizard. It hangs on the final '_'.

`a_long_module_name_is_illegal_`

Everything is fine until we get to the 30th character, which is the final underscore (cap 'A' in place of underscore also hangs). The name isn't too long yet, but one more character after the final '_' would be too many.

 During the setup process, the wizard is asking for the company domain: e.g. `example.com` and previewing the app ID as it's going to be generated: `com.example.my_flutter_app`.

issues.title: Crash creating a new project
issues.body:
## What happened

Created a new project. Accepted to start the project in a new window. IDE error reported in new window.

Note: I just updated the Flutter plugin, then made a new project, and I believe that my Flutter SDK path config was lost during the upgrade, as I'm almost 100% sure that I had previously set (I had created a new project successfully yesterday evening before the update). 

I didn't think to configure it again as I assumed the previous configuration would simply work.

Thanks for any help!

Update: Ah boy, a bit frustrating :( Tried setting the Flutter SDK, but then the project still wasn't created with a proper project and all the files. I then restarted webstorm to see if that would do anything, and tried creating a new project in a fresh directory. Somehow, during the restart, it forgot the Flutter SDK I had just set and reported this error again, or each project has it's own Flutter path which isn't being inherited properly from the previously settings.

issues.title: reload on save can issue multiple reloads
issues.body: Specifically, it'll issue one reload for each open project window.

issues.title: Add validation on 'flutter_test' module name
issues.body:
## Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a new Flutter project and set module name to 'flutter_test'.
Actual result: Process fails with error: 
A package may not list itself as a dependency.
flutter_test:
^^^^^^^^^^
pub get failed (65)

I understand that package 'flutter_test' already exists and automatically added as dev_dependencies.
So, it isn't an actually issue but validation on module name can improve user experience.

Expected result: Validation on 'flutter_test' module name with the same validation message as for 'flutter'.

## Version info
[√] IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition (version 2017.2)
    • Flutter plugin version 17.0
    • Dart plugin version 172.3757.55

> 20/09/2017

> 			This project does not use the Gradle build system. We recommend that you migrate to using the Gradle build system.
> 			More Information about migrating to Gradle
> 			Don't show this message again.

I created this Flutter project the 8th of September and I am using Gradle (AFAIK) - I have files like android/build.gradle, gradlew and settings.gradle etc. in the project and when I run it in the Android emulator I see references to Gradle:

```
Launching lib/main.dart on Android SDK built for x86 in debug mode...
Initializing gradle...
Resolving dependencies...
Running 'gradlew assembleDebug'...
```
So it seems that the issue here is that IntelliJ is not able to identify that my project is using Gradle.

## Steps to Reproduce

Not sure how to reproduce. When I create a new project using "flutter create" everything seems to work fine and IntelliJ is able to pick up that the project is using Gradle.

I did a diff of the android/ folders on the newly created test project and my old project (the one complaining) and most files were identical. In the files that were not, I didn't see anything that was not related to changes I've made myself (like app class name etc.) but I may have overlooked something of course.

issues.title: run action not directed to the correct device

issues.title: Packages get doesn't handle nested packages
issues.body: ## Steps to Reproduce 1. I cloned [flutter/plugins](https://github.com/flutter/plugins). 2. I opened `packages/firebase_database` in IntelliJ. 3. I got analysis errors after running `packages get`: I attempted to fix this by double clicking on `example/pubspec.yaml` and hitting `packages get`, but based on the terminal prompt (`Running 'flutter packages get' in firebase_database...`), it looks like it just ran on the root, not the nested package. Right clicking on `example/pubspec.yaml` and clicking `Flutter > Packages Get` did the same thing. I ended up having to navigate with the command line to resolve this analysis warning. ## Version info ``` [✓] Flutter (on Mac OS X 10.12.4 16E195, channel alpha) • Flutter at /Users/matanl/git/flutter • Framework revision 00214fa7bd (3 weeks ago), 2017-05-16 09:31:35 -0700 • Engine revision f99d3ef108 • Tools Dart version 1.23.0-dev.11.11 [✓] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK 25.0.3) • Android SDK at /Users/matanl/Library/Android/sdk • Platform android-25, build-tools 25.0.3 • Java binary at: /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents/jre/jdk/Contents/Home/bin/java • Java version: OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_112-release-b06) [✓] iOS toolchain - develop for iOS devices (Xcode 8.2.1) • Xcode at /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer • Xcode 8.2.1, Build version 8C1002 • ios-deploy 1.9.1 • CocoaPods version 1.2.1 [✓] Android Studio (version 2.3) • Android Studio at /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents • Gradle version 3.2 • Java version: OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_112-release-b06) [✓] IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate Edition (version 2017.1.3) • Dart plugin version 171.4424.63 • Flutter plugin version 14.0 [✓] Connected devices • None ```

issues.title: not all material design icons are shown in IntelliJ
issues.body: There is skew between the repo we get the icons from (https://github.com/google/material-design-icons), and the material icons font used by Flutter. We should correct, and likely generate the icons directly from the font used by flutter.

issues.title: Confusion around `pub get` prompt
issues.body:
Sometimes, after updating pubspec.yaml in IntelliJ, we just see the Dart banner prompting to update dependencies. The Flutter banner w/ slightly different appearance and wording ("Get Dependencies") never displays. 

My understanding is the vanilla Dart version of the command (`pub get`) is not exactly equivalent to `flutter packages get` which aside from the UX inconsistency, might be a more serious issue. 

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Open pubspec.yaml, either in IntelliJ or in a text editor.
1. Make edits and switch to main.dart in IntelliJ.
1. Sometimes get Dart version of the "update dependencies" banner in IntelliJ, rather than the Flutter version (which is not exactly equivalent).

## Version info

This behavior was seen on the I/O kiosks.

issues.title: Device list can become out of sync with extensive use
issues.body:
## Steps to Reproduce
I have yet to find a way to get reproduce this consistently, but it happens fairly often to me.  I test on several devices and emulators:
Devices: iPhone7, Gen 3 MotoX, Nexus 5
Simulator: iPhone SE, Pixel

After building enough times to some devices, at some point the device list will just stop updating.  I don't know what causes it exactly though.  But that's the use case.  Best advice I can give is try to build a complete app with flutter with several devices.    The issue can be fixed by restarting the IDE.

## Version info

issues.title: removing breakpoint while stopped leaves phantom breakpoint
issues.body:
To reproduce:

- create new Flutter app
- Start the debugger
- set breakpoint at line main.dart line 59 (_counter++)
- press button to stop at breakpoint
- while stopped, remove breakpoint
- resume
- press button

It stops again at the breakpoint, even though it's been removed.

To get rid of the phantom breakpoint, create and remove the breakpoint again while the app is running.

issues.title: Flutter filter being applied to non-Flutter console
issues.body:
Reported by @tvolkert 

To reproduce:
- create new Flutter app
- create a Dart (not Flutter) script:
```
main() {
  print("[{hello}]");
  print("[{world}");
}
```

- Create a "Dart Command Line App" run configuraiton.

Output is:

```
/usr/local/google/home/skybrian/software/flutter/bin/cache/dart-sdk/bin/dart --checked --enable-vm-service:33759 /usr/local/google/home/skybrian/tmp/click/lib/foo.dart
[{world}
```

It looks like we need to attach `DaemonJsonInputFilterProvider` in code, not in plugin.xml

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Don't filter consoles when not in machine mode (#986)

Fixes #984

issues.title: Breakpoint reactivate after hot reload
issues.body:
Summary:
Doing a hot reload after removing a breakpoint, during a debug session, seems to reactivate the breakpoint. The red dot on the left is still gone, but the app still pauses when it gets there. Placing a new breakpoint on the same line and then removing it, fixes the problem.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Create a new project.
2. Set a breakpoint at the line with _counter++;
3. Run in debug mode (I used iOS SE simulator, but it also happened with an android simulator).
4. Tab the button and resume a couple of times
5. Remove the breakpoint and verify that the app no longer pauses.
6. Do a hot reload.
7. Tab the button again.


What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
Expected:
The number should increase by one without any interruption.

Actual:
The app pauses where the breakpoint used to be.

What version of the product are you using?
Flutter framework revision 87d0010adb, 2017-05-02 22:20:14 -0700
Tools Dart version 1.23.0-dev.11.11

IntelliJ IDEA CE 2017.1.2
Flutter plugin version 13.0

On what operating system?
macOS Sierra 10.12.3

Please provide any additional information below.
Note that this might have been the case for earlier versions as well, since I've seen this before, but was unable to reproduce it.

issues.title: projects without Flutter project metadata don't open properly
issues.body:
Seen when testing this:

https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/blob/master/testing.md#project-open-verification

when following those steps, the project opens, but no Flutter SDK is assigned, and I don't believe the project has a Dart nature. To remedy I had to go into the Flutter settings and set up a sdk.

I believe this regressed when we moved to 2017.1 and per-project SDKs. When creating flutter metadata for a project, we should assign an SDK.

Fix setting of Flutter metadata in imported projects (#927). (#928)

Fixes: #927.

issues.title: spurious problem report: "invalid item 'Dart SDK' in the dependencies list"
issues.body:
To reproduce, create a Flutter app from the command line:

```
flutter create click
```

Then open in IDEA and go to Project Structure. The "Problems" tab is highlighted with one problem. If you click on it, you see a message:

```
Module click: invalid item 'Dart SDK' in the dependencies list
```

This can be fixed by editing click.iml and removing the application-level Dart SDK.

Assuming we only support 2017.1 from now on, perhaps we should remove the application-level SDK from any .iml templates and checked-in files for sample projects?

issues.title: breakpoint stops working if you hot reload while stopped at it
issues.body:
Reproduced on Mac with iOS simulator.

To reproduce:
  - create a new Flutter app (click counter)
  - change some text and use hot reload (warmup)
  - set breakpoint at _counter++
  - press the button (to stop at the breakpoint)
  - while stopped, edit something and choose hot reload
  - continue from breakpoint
  - press button again. It doesn't stop.
 
Removing the breakpoint and adding it back again fixes the problem.
It seems to only happen if you set the breakpoint *after* the first hot reload.

issues.title: Fix breakpoints in same package when running on mac bazel with READONLY
issues.body:
Set a breakpoint in IntelliJ (Community edition on OSX, with Flutter and Dart plugins). Attach debugger over the port specified when running app via iOS simulator from command line.

Expected:
IntelliJ stops at breakpoint.
Actual:
IntelliJ console logs from the running app, but breakpoint does not trigger.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fix race condition when there is a breakpoint in main (#795)

We should not set any breakpoints until receiving the app.started
event from the flutter command, because until then, the flutter
command is still using Observatory.

To be safe, don't tell the debugger the Observatory URL until then.

Possibly related to #784 (found while attempting to reproduce it)
but the symptoms are different.

issues.title: issue with debug paths when debugging against an android emulator
issues.body:
To repro:
- create a sample project
- launch against the android emulator

This could also be an issue with spaces in the paths.

issues.title: flutter editor butterbar added to non-flutter projects
issues.body: to repro: - open the flutter repo in intellij - open the pubspec for flutter_tools - see the flutter butterbar (flutter_tools is not a flutter module) I believe the issue is that we check to see if any module in the project is a flutter module, not the module for the current file.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Improve module type testing for pubspec banner (#713). (#717)

Fixes: #713.

issues.title: layout issues in the prefs page on windows
issues.body: The sdk path and version fields in the flutter prefs page doesn't have enough vertical separation on windows:

issues.title: reload and restart actions don't work when app launched in 'run' mode
issues.body:
To repro:

- start an app with the `run` button (not `debug`)
- wait for it to start
- top reload buttons don't work; keybindings don't work (but the bottom reload buttons do work)

issues.title: validate the project name
issues.body: We should validate the project name before creation (it needs to be a valid pub package name, otherwise pub will fail).

issues.title: Reload/Restart/Stop buttons not updating w/ latest flutter tools
missing flutter tools menu

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fix Tools Menu visibility check (#678). (#679)

Fixes: #678.

issues.title: Out of date pubspec inspection lags behind local filesystem changes.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fix pubspec timestamp checking (#715, #667). (#716)

* Fix pubspec timestamp checking (#715, #667).

Bypasses the Virtual FS (which lags) in favor of a trip to `java.io`.

Fixes: #715, #667

* reformat

issues.title: issue with the hot reload key binding and multiple simultaneous launches
issues.body: Tapping hot reload icon works when I switch build configuration tab. However, the keyboard shortcut always runs hot reload on the last run configuration rather than the currently open tab.

issues.title: hot reload icon should be on the toolbar
issues.body: This is currently an issue just with the bazel launch config. The resolution here may be to ensure that users have modules with the flutter type

issues.title: No error message if Dart SDK is not set or is set incorrectly
issues.body:
Currently we find the Flutter SDK from the Dart SDK. If the Dart SDK is not set or it's set to a non-Flutter SDK, we don't show any error message, but any Run Configurations for Flutter are disabled.

We need to somehow tell the user that they should set the Dart SDK to the one in $FLUTTER_SDK/bin/cache/dart-sdk and then everything will work.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Show error when Dart SDK is not set correctly (#646)

Fixes #636

Since the Flutter SDK is derived the from Dart SDK, we actually handle
this by reporting: 'No Flutter SDK configured'. When the user fixes
the Flutter SDK, the Dart SDK will also be fixed.

* Fixed combo box to display correctly when no Flutter SDK is configured.
* Fire a Flutter SDK changed event when the user changes the Flutter SDK.
* Removed dead code.
* fix race condition with Flutter version in dialog

Not done: when the user changes the Dart SDK, we should fire a Flutter
SDK changed event.

issues.title: "flutter instructions" link in error is not clickable
issues.body: Not sure why I'm getting the error in the first place. /src/flutter is a valid sdk. Probably cause the `flutter` tool hasn't been run there, so it has no bin/cache.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the hello_service example in IntelliJ: `file -> open -> /flutter/examples/hello_services/`

issues.title: IntelliJ opens example project without Flutter module
issues.body:
When I open one of the flutter examples in IntelliJ (tested with hello_world, hello_service and gallery), the IDE loads the Dart module but no Flutter module. 

In the _Modul Settings_ (_context menu on the root node in the project tree -> Open Module Settings_) Is one problem listed: "_Project hello_world: project SDK is not defined_". I did't find a way to activate the Flutter Module in the IDE. 

1. There should be a a way, to activate Flutter Support in the IDE
2. The IDE should recognize, that the Flutter module needs to be loaded. Maybe update the Flutter plugin or add a _flutter.yaml_ file in the example projects.

**Informations to reproduce the issue and a workaround to activate the Flutter support:**
1. Get the hello_world example:
> https://github.com/flutter/flutter/tree/b9bff6a912c62c9dae5eddbaef80927655b769d7/examples/hello_world

2. Open the example project in IntelliJ

3. Click on "_Get dependencies_" in the "_'Pub get' has not been run_" message

4. The following error appear:
```
Working dir: /Users/jonas/dart/hello_world
/Users/jonas/Library/flutter/bin/cache/dart-sdk/bin/pub get
Resolving dependencies...
The Flutter SDK is not available.
Depended on by:
- hello_services 
Process finished with exit code 69
```

5. Close IntelliJ and create the file _flutter.yaml_ with this content:
```
name: hello_world
uses-material-design: true
```

6. Restart IntelliJ with the hello_world example.

7. The message "_'hello_world' is not a Flutter module, devide debugging is not fully supported._" appear. 

8. Click on _Change module type to Flutter and reload project_

9. Run the pub action _Get dependencies_ (Should work fine without error).

**Flutter doctor output:**

```
$ flutter doctor

[✓] Flutter (on M.ac OS, channel master)

    • Flutter at /Users/jonas/Library/flutter

    • Framework revision a0c567f751 (5 hours ago), 2016-11-21 20:17:41

    • Engine revision cea5ed2b9b

    • Tools Dart version 1.21.0-dev.6.0



[✓] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK 25.0.0)

    • Android SDK at /Users/jonas/Library/Android/sdk

    • Platform android-25, build-tools 25.0.0

    • Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_111-b14)



[✓] iOS toolchain - develop for iOS devices (Xcode 8.1)

    • XCode at /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer

    • Xcode 8.1, Build version 8B62



[✓] IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition (version 2016.2.5)

    • Dart plugin installed

    • Flutter plugin installed



[✓] Connected devices

    • SM N9005 • eb53b4f0 • android-arm • Android 5.0 (API 21)
```

issues.title: Breakpoint is ignored after code is edited (no reload).
issues.body:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new flutter application with the demo app.
2. Set a breakpoint on the line with "_counter++;"

![screen shot 2016-11-10 at 1 35 50 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4804200/20195595/12189244-a74c-11e6-86c7-1fd5d65850ad.png)

3. Debug "main.dart.
4. Add 6 lines of comments above the breakpoint.  Do not save or reload.

![screen shot 2016-11-10 at 1 47 35 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4804200/20195649/44180a04-a74c-11e6-9f8d-38a8875800aa.png)

5. Click the (+) button in the demo app.

![screen shot 2016-11-10 at 1 48 10 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4804200/20195670/5553814a-a74c-11e6-9a06-3284b649aa14.png)

EXPECTED: Program stops at breakpoint in the original, unedited source code.  This source code is known to the vm and is available through the vm service.
ACTUAL: Breakpoint is apparently ignored.

cc'ing @johnmccutchan

issues.title: Plugin should use flutter packages get instead of pub get

```
Resolving dependencies...
The Flutter SDK is not available.

- flutter_sample
```

Instead of running pub get, it should run `flutter packages get` / `upgrade`

issues.title: Default keyboard shortcuts don't work
issues.body:
Our default keybindings for hot reload and restart don't seem to work well:

_On macOS 10.11.6:_
- Hot reload:
  - Defaults to `cmd-F5`.
  - This launches the Mac 'VoiceOver' app for me.
- Restart:
  - Defaults to `cmd-shift-F5`.
  - This works.

**On Linux:**
- Hot reload:
  - Defaults to `ctrl-F5`.
  - Doesn't do anything at all
- Restart:
  - Defaults to `ctrl-shift-F5`.
  - Doesn't do anything at all

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Update restart/reload button enablement (#407, #332). (#426)

Updates button enablement to track Flutter app running state.

Addresses some of #407.

Fixes: #332.

issues.title: Device picker is missing
issues.body:
After upgrading to 0.1.1, I no longer see the device picker:
![screen shot 2016-10-19 at 14 53 53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13644170/19519522/ac753834-960c-11e6-974a-d2bf4e0b07eb.png)

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fix device selector filtering (#330). (#333)

Fixes #330

issues.title: Exception while activating newly installed flutter plugin.
issues.body:
IntelliJ seems to indicate that we are accessing UI components from a background thread.

Steps to reproduce: I was following installation instructions:

> Flutter plugin installation
> 
> During alpha development, the Flutter plugin is hosted in its own plugin repository. Before it can be installed, the repository needs to be added to the IDE.
> 
> Open plugin preferences (Preferences>Plugins on macOS, File>Settings>Plugins on Linux)
> Select "Browse repositories…"
> In the Browse Repositories dialog, click "Manage repositories…"
> In the resulting Custom Plugin Repositories pop-up, click the + button and paste https://flutter.github.io/flutter-intellij/alpha/updatePlugins.xml into the Repository URL: field and click OK
> In the Browse Repositories dialog, select flutter-intellij from the list of plugins (be sure it is not being filtered out of your results view by specifying Category: All or limiting it to the Flutter repository in the pull-down by the search box) and click the green Install button
> Once downloaded, click the Restart IntelliJ IDEA button
> Flutter plugin configuration
> 
> Open preferences (Preferences on macOS, File>Settings on Linux)
> Select Languages & Frameworks>Flutter
> Set the path to the root of your flutter repo
> Click OK

Exception occurred after the final OK click. Happens again after restart of IntelliJ and repetition of the last four steps above.

issues.title: NPE on app debug
issues.body:
```
@NotNull method io/flutter/run/FlutterAppState.startProcess must not return null
java.lang.IllegalStateException: @NotNull method io/flutter/run/FlutterAppState.startProcess must not return null
    at io.flutter.run.FlutterAppState.startProcess(FlutterAppState.java:92)

```

To repro (this scenario is not a common one for users):
- open an existing flutter project
- install the flutter plugin
- restart
- set the path to the flutter sdk
- devices now show up in the device pulldown
- hit debug; see exception

3. It prompted that Dart support is not enabled, enable it

issues.title: Debug single app on multiple devices simultaneously
issues.body:
The plugin should allow a developer to attach multiple devices or simulators and use all of them at the same time while working on a single app. They should be able to set breakpoints that are active in all sessions, individually single step the debugger for a single device, resume and exit the app on each device without affecting other devices.

One could imagine setting a breakpoint on a per-device level but I don't think the IJ UX supports that so, for now, breakpoints are universal. Although we should see what AS does in this case.

(The case of multiple apps is already supported since each app appears as its own IJ project window. If we find projects that contain multiple apps we will need to test them.)

issues.title: Dart not always enabled for new Flutter Projects created from source.
issues.body: I created a new Flutter project on existing sources and found that it did not have Dart support enabled. I had to open the pubspec.yaml file and enable it there. It should have been done as part of project creation.

issues.title: Don't hang if debugging is started while already debugging
issues.body: Current if you hit the Debug button while already debugging the session hangs, and you have to restart IntellJ. If the longer term fix to this -- which I believe involves supporting multiple debugging sessions -- is too hard, then short term perhaps we can just 'do nothing' when we are already debugging?

issues.title: errors written to the console on hot reload
issues.body:
```
Error: Expected response for class com.jetbrains.lang.dart.ide.runner.server.vmService.VmServiceWrapper$4
  but received {"type":"Sentinel","kind":"Collected","valueAsString":"<collected>"}
```

This will probably require changes to the debugger code; it needs to be more tolerant of sentinels being returned instead of the expected values, and we shouldn't spam library errors to the console.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Watch for SDK config changes and trigger daemon starts/stops (#178). (#277)

Makes the device daemon more “self-healing”.

With this, the “Clean Install” user story becomes:

1. Install Flutter plugin
2. Restart IDE
3. Create Flutter project (setting SDK in the process)
4. Profit

:)

No more extra restart and fatal exceptions.

Fixes: https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/178

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fix Daemon initialization issue (#157). (#159)

* Cleanup unnneeded `DartBundle` reference.

* Revert "Cleanup unnneeded `DartBundle` reference."

This reverts commit 75ddc84cb015c1109a16ae8dcec2329e19ded3c9.

* Fix Daemon initialization issue (#157).

Migrates initialization to a startup activity.  The `ApplicationTable` should be reliably available then.

Fixes: https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/157

issues.title: Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV) | Cause: null pointer dereference | Converting object to an encodable object failed: Infinity
issues.body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. Make a tall image (with height / width > screen.height / screen.width)
2. Run this code in debug mode:
```dart
Column(
  children: <Widget>[
    Image.asset(
      'assets/image.png',
      width: double.infinity,
    ),
  ],
)
```

[Example project](https://github.com/PiN73/test_infinity)


## Expected behavior

- Image overflows screen
- Bottom edge of column is marked with a yellow/black striped pattern
- Exception is printed in *Run tab*
- App keeps running

It actually **works** this way if I do `flutter run` **from Windows command line.**

But when I run the app from **Android Studio**, things change, see below


## Actual behavior

- Image overflows screen
- Bottom edge of column is marked with a yellow/black striped pattern
- Exception is printed in *Run tab*
- After a moment native crash occurs:
```
F/libc    (21077): Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV), code 1 (SEGV_MAPERR), fault addr 0x18 in tid 21118 (1.ui), pid 21077 (p.test_infinity)
*** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** ***
Build fingerprint: 'xiaomi/jasmine/jasmine_sprout:9/PKQ1.180904.001/V10.0.14.0.PDIMIXM:user/release-keys'
Revision: '0'
ABI: 'arm64'
pid: 21077, tid: 21118, name: 1.ui  >>> p.test_infinity <<<
signal 11 (SIGSEGV), code 1 (SEGV_MAPERR), fault addr 0x18
Cause: null pointer dereference

    x4  000000706478d030  x5  000000706596a8b4  x6  000000705cff2801  x7  0000000000000127
    x8  0000007077c1dc78  x9  000000706478d0e8  x10 0000000000000000  x11 000000706478d1a0

issues.title: Feature: navigate to intervals in observatory from the perf timeline

Food for thought!


/cc @johnpryan @jacob314 @terrylucas

issues.title: On Flutter dev channel (v0.5.7), cannot start debugger (wrong URL)
issues.body:
Thanks for the feedback! If your issue is related to the Flutter framework itself,
please open an issue at
[github.com/flutter/flutter](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/new).

## Steps to Reproduce

_Please tell us what you were doing and what went wrong_

From: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/13747#issuecomment-409026950
I have examined the behaviour:

As for IntelliJ, when start the app in debug mode, for example, if the flutter server is started:
```
# lsof -Pn -i4 | grep dart
dart      9230 wildcat   11u  IPv4 0xe009aa0184cff1fd      0t0  TCP 10.116.200.4:53196->216.58.204.14:443 (ESTABLISHED)
```
According to the output above, the target port should be 53196. However, in IntelliJ/Android Studio, the error message is:
```
Launching lib/main.dart on iPhone X in debug mode...
Error connecting to the service protocol: Exception: Attempted to connect to Dart observatory 5 times, and all attempts failed. Giving up. The URL was ws://127.0.0.1:53/ws
```

Hint: the URL is `ws://127.0.0.1:53/ws` instead of `ws://127.0.0.1:53196/ws`

Please note that, in the same version of Flutter (0.5.7), I can debug (making break points) with VSCode and the flutter/dart plugin.

## Version info

Please paste the output of running `flutter doctor -v` here (available from the command
line or from `Tools > Flutter > Flutter Doctor`). It will provide the version of the
Flutter framework as well as of the IntelliJ plugin.

[✓] Flutter (Channel dev, v0.5.7, on Mac OS X 10.14 18A347e, locale en-GB)
[✓] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK 27.0.3)
[✓] iOS toolchain - develop for iOS devices (Xcode 10.0)
[✓] Android Studio (version 3.1)
[✓] IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate Edition (version 2018.2)

Note: on channel of beta, there is no such a problem.

issues.title: Android studio seems to be executing an old version of my app
issues.body:
## Steps to Reproduce

I have a simple app that uses an android alarm to print something to console every minute.  I started with the example from flutter/plugins for `android_alarm_manager`.  After changing the alarm and restarting the app (using the play button) the app is continuing to output the content of the previous build of my app.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16123225/38595128-ba944528-3cfe-11e8-9e70-353dd551f29d.png)

issues.title: apps don't consistently resume from the PauseStart state
issues.body:
It looks like a regression due to https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/commit/7bd4f0f65293c226d6acff7f53437388feebb901.

Note, the logic to resume at start is handled by the Dart plugin, in or around:
https://github.com/JetBrains/intellij-plugins/blob/2f85a778ce22c7f2592269de32fbf4aeb825672c/Dart/src/com/jetbrains/lang/dart/ide/runner/server/vmService/VmServiceWrapper.java#L164

issues.title: Connect same running app to two devices?
issues.body:
Hey all, I think this is supported by Flutter, but wasn't sure if I could do this in IntelliJ.

What I'd like:

  1. Open iOS simulator and Android Emulator, put em side-by-side
  2. Launch the app from IntelliJ, deploying to both devices
  3. When I make changes and it hot reloads, both devices should show updates.

Is this possible and I missed how to do it? I tried simply launching two different debugging sessions, but when I perform a Hot Reload it only reflects on the most recently run device.

Overall this could be a big time saver for me so I don't have to switch / rebuild to ensure visual changes look good on both platforms!

As always, thanks for the great plugin and listening to our feedback :)

issues.title: must del 'build' dir to see changes in run/debug
issues.body:
## Steps to Reproduce
I have to delete the build directory to get code changes to be run/debugged.

A few changes will be pushed to emulator but eventually must delete build.
neither Hot Reload, Run, & Debug update app properly. Even completely stopping & restarting run/debug still runs previous code.

In the attached run window dump, I deleted build, just added '&&' in unfinished statement to force code to fail. Build to debug. Fails as expected. Removed &&, debug, hot, etc. not seen, still fails. Had to again delete build dir to get code running.

And, though the code is edited, the read-only version of main.dart that opens still shows the '&&' old code (reflecting the current failing build that is actually running)

issues.title: Hot reload and restart should cause the Console to scroll to the bottom
issues.body:
From @floitschG recent getting started log.

Working as expected:

1. Make the console not very tall so that it easily "overflows"
1. Create new app
1. Introduce a runtime error (e.g., add `int x = 42 ~/ 0;` above `_counter++;`)
1. Run app
1. Trigger runtime error (press `+` button)

=> Console scrolls to the botton of the error

1. Trigger runtime error again

=> Console scrolls to the botton of the error

*Not* working as expected:

1. Scroll up a bit in the Console
1. Trigger runtime error again

=> Console no longer scrolls to the botton

issues.title: removing breakpoint while stopped leaves phantom breakpoint
issues.body:
To reproduce:

- create new Flutter app
- Start the debugger
- set breakpoint at line main.dart line 59 (_counter++)
- press button to stop at breakpoint
- while stopped, remove breakpoint
- resume
- press button

It stops again at the breakpoint, even though it's been removed.

To get rid of the phantom breakpoint, create and remove the breakpoint again while the app is running.

issues.title: Breakpoint reactivate after hot reload
issues.body:
Summary:
Doing a hot reload after removing a breakpoint, during a debug session, seems to reactivate the breakpoint. The red dot on the left is still gone, but the app still pauses when it gets there. Placing a new breakpoint on the same line and then removing it, fixes the problem.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Create a new project.
2. Set a breakpoint at the line with _counter++;
3. Run in debug mode (I used iOS SE simulator, but it also happened with an android simulator).
4. Tab the button and resume a couple of times
5. Remove the breakpoint and verify that the app no longer pauses.
6. Do a hot reload.
7. Tab the button again.


What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
Expected:
The number should increase by one without any interruption.

Actual:
The app pauses where the breakpoint used to be.

What version of the product are you using?
Flutter framework revision 87d0010adb, 2017-05-02 22:20:14 -0700
Tools Dart version 1.23.0-dev.11.11

IntelliJ IDEA CE 2017.1.2
Flutter plugin version 13.0

On what operating system?
macOS Sierra 10.12.3

Please provide any additional information below.
Note that this might have been the case for earlier versions as well, since I've seen this before, but was unable to reproduce it.

issues.title: hot reload doesn't work when stopped at a breakpoint
issues.body:
To reproduce:
  - create a new Flutter project
  - set a breakpoint at _counter++;
  - launch in debugger
  - press button to stop at breakpoint
  - press hot reload icon

At this point, a background task spins: "Intializing hot reload..." and that Flutter app is still frozen. Pressing "Resume Program" doesn't help.

A message is logged:
```
[ 984658]   WARN - o.flutter.run.daemon.DaemonApi - Flutter process returned an error: {"id":1,"error":"TimeoutException: Request to Dart VM Service timed out: _flutter.listViews({})"} 
```

issues.title: investigate having on on-device dirty badge for hot reload
issues.body: Related to https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/896, but the dirty indicator would be on device, and perhaps have a similar look to the 'slow mode' indicator.

issues.title: badge the hot reload icon with the number of un-pushed changes
issues.body: This would be a single 'dirty' marker on the hot reload icon, or a count badge for the number of unpushed dirty libraries / changes lines / diffs.

issues.title: breakpoint ignored after hot reload
issues.body:
This is while testing the prerelease for version 12.0, using Bazel integration.

In a hello world:
  - set breakpoint at _counter++
  - press the button.
  - See that it stops at the breakpoint. Resume.
  - Modify some text and hit hot reload.
  - See that the text changed.
  - Press the button. It should stop at the breakpoint but doesn't.

issues.title: Potential issue with debugging from IDE into iOS simulator
issues.body:
From a recent study with developers:

"When using iOS simulator, a breakpoint in the build function for initial main widget of an app would lead an error message. We continued past the breakpoint and the screen was black until the app is restarted. This was reproducing consistently. I suspect there’s a race condition on surface setup that the breakpoint is causing to work out not in our favor."

issues.title: Still breaking at removed breakpoint
issues.body: Encountered when setting (and unsetting) a breakpoint in the demo app. Debugger stops even though IDEA doesn't see the breakpoint anymore. cc @devoncarew

issues.title: Fix breakpoints in same package when running on mac bazel with READONLY
issues.body:
Set a breakpoint in IntelliJ (Community edition on OSX, with Flutter and Dart plugins). Attach debugger over the port specified when running app via iOS simulator from command line.

Expected:
IntelliJ stops at breakpoint.
Actual:
IntelliJ console logs from the running app, but breakpoint does not trigger.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fix race condition when there is a breakpoint in main (#795)

We should not set any breakpoints until receiving the app.started
event from the flutter command, because until then, the flutter
command is still using Observatory.

To be safe, don't tell the debugger the Observatory URL until then.

Possibly related to #784 (found while attempting to reproduce it)
but the symptoms are different.

issues.title: Reload/Restart/Stop buttons not updating w/ latest flutter tools
Expose new async stack enhancement from VM
Debugger doesn't stop at breakpoints in hello_services example on Android
issues.body:
_From @jsiedentop on November 23, 2016 18:59_

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the hello_service example in IntelliJ: `file -> open -> /flutter/examples/hello_services/`
2. Set a breakpoint (for example in line 66 inside of `main()`)
3. Start debugging: `run -> debug`
4. The example app start on the android device, but doesn't stop at breakpoints.

Tested with ``HTC One M8`` and ``Samsung Galaxy Note 3``. An other user in the flutter gitter chat report the same issue.

issues.title: Option to break on handled exceptions in Flutter framework
issues.body:
_From @sethladd on January 29, 2016 18:29_

_From @sethladd on January 12, 2016 17:5_

Was: https://github.com/dart-atom/dartlang/issues/630

Flutter handles most (all?) exceptions thrown from user code. This is usually pretty great, except when I'm debugging. I want my app to stop at the point of the exception, so I can work on fixing it.

Normally, the editor can break on unhandled exceptions. But for handled exceptions, we might need to do something "Flutter aware".

_Copied from original issue: flutter/atom-flutter#31_


_Copied from original issue: flutter/flutter#1476_

issues.title: Be careful when stopping on caught exceptions in an editor
issues.body:
_From @Hixie on May 13, 2016 17:33_

The framework tries to catch most exceptions and report them in detail. However, by breaking on all exceptions, Atom is stealing the framework's thunder! :-)

We probably need to coordinate better. There's some exceptions where the handler is able to give really detailed helpful messages, and there's others where it's just "uh, something bad happened".

cc @devoncarew 


_Copied from original issue: flutter/flutter#3899_

issues.title: Breakpoint is ignored after code is edited (no reload).
issues.body:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new flutter application with the demo app.
2. Set a breakpoint on the line with "_counter++;"

![screen shot 2016-11-10 at 1 35 50 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4804200/20195595/12189244-a74c-11e6-86c7-1fd5d65850ad.png)

3. Debug "main.dart.
4. Add 6 lines of comments above the breakpoint.  Do not save or reload.

![screen shot 2016-11-10 at 1 47 35 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4804200/20195649/44180a04-a74c-11e6-9f8d-38a8875800aa.png)

5. Click the (+) button in the demo app.

![screen shot 2016-11-10 at 1 48 10 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4804200/20195670/5553814a-a74c-11e6-9a06-3284b649aa14.png)

EXPECTED: Program stops at breakpoint in the original, unedited source code.  This source code is known to the vm and is available through the vm service.
ACTUAL: Breakpoint is apparently ignored.

cc'ing @johnmccutchan

issues.title: Restore breakpoints after hot reload
issues.body: When the Hot Reload button is clicked the code on the selected device is updated but the breakpoints are lost for that device. If multiple devices are connected only the breakpoints on the reloaded device are lost. The breakpoint locations are not changing in this case (I just changed one character in a string to test that). This needs to be solved by the IDE since the daemon has no information about breakpoints.
